summary: The Sept. 5 show was one of many events held during Billboardโs R&B/Hip-Hop Week.
body: When word got out that the Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players event would be taking over Webster Hall for a free concert on Friday (Sept. 5), New Yorkers from all walks of life consumed three blocks waiting โ and hoping โ to get inside. Those lucky enough to gain entry celebrated every second of the night, as DJ Ohso meticulously spun through hip-hop bangers, sultry afro tunes and a little bit of Paramore to keep the crowd energized, engaged and hungry for a showcase from Billboard ‘s Rookies of the Year. Attendee’s workday blues than completely vanished โฆ

body: Dua Lipa treated fans to a surprise during the opening U.S. date of her Radical Optimism World Tour. On Friday (Sept. 5), the 30-year-old British pop star launched a two-night stint at Chicagoโs United Center, dazzling the sold-out crowd with striking costumes and a 22-song setlist that featured tracks from her latest album, Radical Optimism . Together, the duo performed a powerful rendition of Khanโs 1983 classic โAinโt Nobody.โ Watch fan-captured footage of the moment here . This isnโt the first time Lipa has shared the stage with iconic artists during her global tour. title: Eladio Carriรณn Delivers Next-Level Energy at Barclays Center With Star Guests, Retro-Futuristic Visuals & Yakuza Flair: 5 BestยMoments
summary: The Puerto Rican rapper made his arena debut in NYC, and brought Young Miko, Rich the Kid, and more to the stage as part of his DON KBRN World Tour.
body: Eladio Carriรณn is no stranger to breaking barriers, and his explosive takeover of Brooklynโs Barclays Center proved once again that heโs operating on a whole new level. In just two years, the U.S.-born, Puerto Rican rapper elevated his career from performing in intimate venues like The Theater at Madison Square Garden to headlining arena territory at the Barclays Center. His arrival in New York City comes one week after he launched his DON KBRN World Tour, presented by Live Nation, on Aug. 27 in Charlotte, N.C. Kicking off the show at 9 p.m., the Kansas City-born artist lit up the stage with tracks from his latest album DON KBRN , including fan favorites like โInvencible,โ โOhtani,โ โVetements,โ โH.I.M.โ and โBroly.โ He also performed songs from his albums Sol Marรญa (2024), 3MEN2 KBRN (2023), SEN2KBRN VOL. 2 (2022), Sauce Boyz 2 (2021), and his 2024 EP Porque Puedo . (See the full setlist here .) Over the course of two hours, the Latin trap star delivered a show packed with jaw-dropping yakuza-inspired visuals, surprise guests โ Young Miko, Rich the Kid, Ty Dolla $ign, Lenny Tavรกrez, J Quiles โ and undeniable energy.  Next, the Sauce Boyz hitmaker will bring his electrifโฆ

title: Karol G Dazzles With Tropical NFL Halftime Show in Sรฃo Paulo: โHey,ยBrazil!โ
summary: The Colombian star headlined the season opener spectacle on Friday (Sept. 5).
body: Karol G brought her Tropicoqueta energy to the NFL stage in Brazil, where she headlined the halftime show on Friday night (Sept. 5) during the season opener between the Kansas City Chiefs and the Los Angeles Chargers. Related Karol G Expands Winning Streak on Latin Airplay Chart With โLatina Forevaโ Milo J, Grupo Firme, Sech & More: Who Had the Best New Latin Music Release This Week? Which New Music Release Is Your Favorite This Week? Vote! The Colombian superstar’s performance was streamed live on the NFLโs YouTube channel from Corinthians Arena in Sรฃo Paulo, where she opened her short-but-dazzling set singing some verses in Portuguese, before switching to Spanish for “Bandida Entrenada.” “Hey, Brazil!” she greeted the audience with excitement. “ยกArriba mi gente latina!” (Up my Latin people!) Dressed in a brown and yellow miniskirt with copper details and a bra with yellow pineapples for cups, Karol, with her wavy dark blond hair down, performed a medley that included her Billboard Hot Latin Songs No. 1 hit “Si Antes Te Hubiera Conocido,” “Un Gatito Me Llamรณ” and “Papasito,” which she performedโฆ

title: Can SoundExchange Bring Lawsuits? SiriusXM Appeal Will Shape RoyaltiesยEnforcement
summary: SoundExchange says an "erroneous ruling" incorrectly barred it from collecting royalties via litigation.
body: A major court ruling last month found that SoundExchange doesnโt have the power to collect royalties through litigation. Now, the organization has launched an appeal in hopes of preserving this enforcement strategy. SoundExchangeโs notice of appeal on Friday (Sept. 5) challenges an August federal court ruling that dismissed its $400 million lawsuit against SiriusXM. Judge Naomi Reice Buchwald held in her decision that SoundExchange, a nonprofit designated by the Copyright Royalty Board to collect performance royalties for artists, does not actually have the right to sue anybody under federal law. Related SoundExchange Loses SiriusXM Lawsuit: Judge Says Royalties Org Is โNot a Legal Advocacy Group’ Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 This ruling was the first to weigh in on SoundExchangeโs standing to collect recorded royalties via lawsuits, and the implications are big. For more than a decade, the organization has regularly used litigation to secure hundreds of millions of dollars in royalties from radio broadcasters like SiriusXM โฆ

source.name: Billboard

title: In Canada: Alex Warren Speaks Out After Exiting Sommo Festival, Says โIโm Going Through aยLotโ
summary: In other Canadian industry news this week, Karan Aujla sets a Punjabi-language chart record and Paul Haagenson joins Bruce Allen Entertainment.
body: Alex Warren is doing something un ordinary for a pop star. On Sep. 3, organizers of P.E.Iโs Sommo Festival shared that the โOrdinaryโ singer withdrew from the event due to โa recently booked scheduling conflict,โ in a now-deleted social post. Related Alex Warrenโs โOrdinaryโ Is Billboardโs No. 1 Global Song of the Summer for 2025 Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 “With the festival being next week, as you can imagine, this leaves us in a difficult position,” they wrote. “We are working hard to complete the lineup, and you’ll be the first to know when we do.” Warren was set to join the East Coast two-day festival from September 13-14, with headliners Hozier and Alanis Morissette, and support from Ducks Ltd., PVRIS, Alice Merton, Chiara Savasta, Michael Marcagi, Hollow Coves and more. Later that night, the chart-topping star took to TikTok to share his perspective โ and set the record straight. โFour weeks ago, I asked for time off. Iโm going through a lot of stuff, Iโve been touring all year, I have rehearsโฆ

source.name: Billboard

title: Sphere Entertainment Stock Jumps for Second Week on โWizard of OzโยHype
summary: The Billboard Global Music Index rose 1.7% to 3,301.18, bringing its year-to-date gain to 42.7%.
body: Sphere Entertainment Co. was the top-performing music stock for the second consecutive week after gaining 7.8% to $48.90 for the week ended Sept. 5. After rising 6.8% the previous week, Sphere Entertainment rode continued enthusiasm for the revamped The Wizard of Oz that debuted at Sphere on Aug. 28. On Wednesday (Sept. 3), the stock reached a 52-week high of $49.98 after the company announced it repurchased $27.5 million of common stock, putting it within reach of its all-time high of $51.19 set in February 2021. Related Which Music Companies Had the Best Stock Returns in the Last Three Years? Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 German concert promoter CTS Eventim was the No. 2 music stock of the week, rising 5.5% to 84.45 euros ($98.99). On Tuesday, Rothschild & Co. upgraded CTS Eventim to a โbuyโ rating and lowered its price target to 105.00 euros ($123.08) from 109.00 euros ($127.77).  Spotify was No. 3 after gaining 3.6% to $707.19. On Wednesday, Guggenheim reiterated its โbuyโ rating and $850 price target for Spotify whileโฆ

source.name: Billboard

title: Damon Dash Declares Bankruptcy, Citing More Than $25M in Debts
summary: The Roc-A-Fella Records co-founder owes quite a bit of money in tax bills, unpaid child support and court judgments.
body: Roc-A-Fella Records co-founder Damon Dash has filed for bankruptcy, saying he has just over $4,000 to his name and owes more than $25 million in tax bills, child support and court judgments. Dash, who co-founded Roc-A-Fella with Jay-Z and Kareem โBiggsโ Burke in 1994, is seeking to clear his debts through a so-called Chapter 7 bankruptcy petition filed Thursday (Sept. 4) in Florida. It comes almost exactly a year after Dashโs one-third interest in Roc-A-Fella was auctioned off to the state of New York due to these same debts. Related Judge Postpones Auction of Damon Dash’s Roc-A-Fella Stake. Here’s Why It’ll Now Cost a Lot More Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 According to the petition, Dash has just $100 in cash on hand and a few possessions worth a total of $4,250. These items include $2,500 worth of jewelry, plus a cellphone, clothes and two guns. Dashโs debts far outweigh his assets. He claims to owe a whopping $25.3 million, $19 million of which is composed of unpaid taxes to authorities in New York, New Jersey โฆ

source.name: Billboard

title: โSoda Popโ Choreographer Lee Jung Says Sheโs Ready to Move From Saja Boys to BTS After Success of โKPop DemonยHuntersโ
summary: THE BLACK LABEL choreographer also created the moves for HUNTR/X's "How It's Done" in the hit Netflix film.
body: KPop Demon Hunters has shattered records once again. After becoming the most-watched film in Netflix history, standout track “Golden” went on to top the Billboard Hot 100 chart (for three weeks so far). As a film centered around K-pop, this is more than just a box-office milestone; itโs a landmark in the history of the genre itself. Related ‘Golden’ Choreographer Jo Na-In ‘Stunned & Thrilled’ That ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Song Topped Hot 100, Wants to Work With Lady Gaga Next Dua Lipa Covers Aretha Franklin in Liberating Short Film for YSL's Libre Eau de Parfum: Shop the Fragrance Kansas City Chiefs vs. Los Angeles Chargers: How to Watch NFL Game in Brazil Online for Free So why has this film resonated so strongly? This can be understood in the same context as K-popโs global popularity. Throughout its evolution, K-pop has consistently maintained a balance between music, performance and choreography. Performance videos have become almost mandatory alongside K-pop music videos, and every comeback promotion is accompanied by a dance challenge. K-pop is never just the music โ it is the music with performance. In the same way, Kโฆ
